title: 11.4 Open Addressing
content:
Section 11.4

Open Addressing

Summary

Handle collisions by probing for empty slots within the table itself.

Key Points

  • No chaining: all elements stored in the table
  • Linear probing: h(k,i) = (h'(k) + i) mod m
  • Quadratic probing: h(k,i) = (h'(k) + c₁i + c₂i²) mod m
  • Double hashing: h(k,i) = (h₁(k) + i·h₂(k)) mod m
  • Deletion is tricky: use DELETED marker

Pseudocode

HASH-INSERT(T, k):
    i = 0
    repeat
        j = h(k, i)
        if T[j] == NIL:
            T[j] = k
            return j
        i = i + 1
    until i == m
    error "hash table overflow"

Example

Linear probing: insert 12, 22, 32 (all hash to 2). 12→slot 2, 22→slot 3, 32→slot 4.

Why It Matters

Better cache performance than chaining, but clustering can be an issue.
